subject: Personal Finance
title: Why Countries Trade
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Countries Trade.

hook.text: Saudi Arabia sells oil, Japan sells cars, Colombia sells coffee. Why not just make everything at home?

buildup.text: Comparative advantage means each country produces what it can make most efficiently relative to others.

discovery.text: Trade lets everyone specialize. The result: more goods, lower prices, and higher living standards globally.

twist.text: But trade creates losers too. Factory workers in rich countries lose jobs to cheaper foreign labor.

climax.text: The net effect of trade is positive, but the benefits and costs are distributed very unevenly.

punchline.text: Trade grows the pie. Sharing it is the hard part.

quiz.question: What is comparative advantage?
options: Producing what you're relatively most efficient at
Being the cheapest producer of everything
